description: This creamy Marry Me Soup is a delightful blend of flavors that promises to impress anyone who tries it. With its rich texture and aromatic ingredients, it's perfect for cozy dinners or special occasions.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and thyme, season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for an additional 5 minutes, then serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
tips: For the best flavor, use fresh shrimp and don't overcook them to maintain their tenderness.

Preparation:
Chop the onion and garlic, and peel and devein the shrimp. Measure out the cream and broth.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the instructions step-by-step, ensuring to sauté the onion and garlic until translucent before adding the broth.
Finishing Touches:
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving to add a pop of color and freshness.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the shrimp just until pink to avoid a rubbery texture.
  • A common mistake is overcooking the shrimp; keep an eye on them!
  • When the soup is creamy and heated through, it's ready to serve.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This soup has brought so much joy to my family gatherings. Sharing it with friends and family always creates a warm atmosphere, filled with laughter and love.
Consider adding a splash of lemon juice for brightness or a pinch of red pepper flakes for a bit of heat. Fresh herbs like dill or basil can also enhance the flavor profile beautifully.
This soup pairs wonderfully with crusty bread or a light salad. A glass of white wine can elevate the dining experience even further.
For a vegetarian version, swap shrimp for mushrooms and use vegetable broth. You can also add spinach or kale for added nutrition and color.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• For a velvety texture, blend the soup before adding the shrimp.
  • Use homemade broth for maximum flavor.
  • Timing is key; add the cream at the end to prevent curdling.
  • Serve in warm bowls to keep the soup hot longer.
